title: I want to build a house on a land which is on my mother’s name. Do I need to take ownership of that land, or can the land be on her name and the house be on my name? - Quora

response.answer_text: The land in your mother's name and any structure built on it shall also be owned by your mother only and after her death the complete property shall get divided between all her heirs including your siblings and father. If you want to play safe, get the land transferred in your name by way of gift deed made in your favour by your mother, get the Gift Deed registered with the Sub-Registrar of the district after paying the Stamp Duty applicable in the State for this transfer process. Thus after building the house on this piece of land you shall be sole owner of the property.

1.Equal share of all children's in parantal property. That you mind. 2.If you are lone son then you can build the land in the name of her. 3. You can even get a NOC to built house from her with her conditions if any. 4. You can make joints agreement of redevelopment/reconstruction mentioning terms and conditions execeptable to both of you. Area of plot, construction area. Facility. And pay stamp duty registration and get building permission. After the construction make appropriate changes in property card filing agreement and sanctioned plan of municipality. If it is in village only property card correction nessesarry. For sr. no 4 you are entitled for bank lone too.
